Package org.apache.zookeeper.client

Class ZooKeeperBuilder

java.lang.Object
org.apache.zookeeper.client.ZooKeeperBuilder
@Public @Evolving public class ZooKeeperBuilder extends Object
Builder to construct ZooKeeper and ZooKeeperAdmin.

  • Constructor Details

    • ZooKeeperBuilder

      public ZooKeeperBuilder(String connectString, Duration sessionTimeout)
      Creates a builder with given connect string and session timeout.
      Parameters:
      connectString - comma separated host:port pairs, each corresponding to a zk server. e.g. "127.0.0.1:3000,127.0.0.1:3001,127.0.0.1:3002" If the optional chroot suffix is used the example would look like: "127.0.0.1:3000,127.0.0.1:3001,127.0.0.1:3002/app/a" where the client would be rooted at "/app/a" and all paths would be relative to this root - ie getting/setting/etc... "/foo/bar" would result in operations being run on "/app/a/foo/bar" (from the server perspective).
      sessionTimeout - session timeout

  • Method Details

      public ZooKeeperBuilder withDefaultWatcher(Watcher watcher)
      Specified watcher to receive state changes, and node events if attached later.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      this

      public ZooKeeperBuilder withHostProvider(Function<Collection<InetSocketAddress>,HostProvider> hostProvider)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      this

    • withCanBeReadOnly

      public ZooKeeperBuilder withCanBeReadOnly(boolean canBeReadOnly)
      Specifies whether the created client is allowed to go to read-only mode in case of partitioning.
      Parameters:
      canBeReadOnly - whether the created client is allowed to go to read-only mode in case of partitioning. Read-only mode basically means that if the client can't find any majority servers but there's partitioned server it could reach, it connects to one in read-only mode, i.e. read requests are allowed while write requests are not. It continues seeking for majority in the background.
      Returns:
      this
      Since:
      3.4

    • withSession

      public ZooKeeperBuilder withSession(long sessionId, byte[] sessionPasswd)
      Specifies session id and password in session reestablishment.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - session id to use if reconnecting, otherwise 0 to open new session
      sessionPasswd - password for this session
      Returns:
      this
      See Also:
      • ZooKeeper.getSessionId()
      • ZooKeeper.getSessionPasswd()

    • withClientConfig

      public ZooKeeperBuilder withClientConfig(ZKClientConfig clientConfig)
      Specifies the client config used to construct ZooKeeper instances.
      Parameters:
      clientConfig - passing this conf object gives each client the flexibility of configuring properties differently compared to other instances
      Returns:
      this
      Since:
      3.5.2
